001package io.github.ai4ci.example;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.PrintWriter;
005import java.lang.reflect.Method;
006import java.nio.file.Files;
007import java.nio.file.Path;
008import java.nio.file.Paths;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.Comparator;
012import java.util.HashMap;
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.Map;
015import java.util.stream.Collectors;
016
017import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
018
019import io.github.ai4ci.Import;
020import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
021// import io.github.classgraph.classloader.Handler;
022import io.github.classgraph.ClassGraph;
023import io.github.classgraph.ClassInfo;
024import io.github.classgraph.ScanResult;
025
026/**
027 * Generates R interfacer::iface() specifications from all @Import-annotated
028 * interfaces in a given Java package.
029 *
030 * Output is written to an R file.
031 */
032public class InterfaceSchemaGenerator {
033
034        // Map Java types to R interfacer types
035        private static final Map<Class<?>, String> TYPE_MAPPING = new HashMap<>();
036        static {
037                TYPE_MAPPING.put(String.class, "character");
038                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Integer.class, "integer");
039                TYPE_MAPPING.put(int.class, "integer");
040                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Long.class, "double");
041                TYPE_MAPPING.put(long.class, "double");
042                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Double.class, "double");
043                TYPE_MAPPING.put(double.class, "double");
044                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Float.class, "numeric");
045                TYPE_MAPPING.put(float.class, "numeric");
046                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Boolean.class, "logical");
047                TYPE_MAPPING.put(boolean.class, "logical");
048                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Short.class, "integer");
049                TYPE_MAPPING.put(short.class, "integer");
050                TYPE_MAPPING.put(Byte.class, "integer");
051                TYPE_MAPPING.put(byte.class, "integer");
052        }
053
054        private static Method findIdMethod(Class<?> cls) {
055                return Arrays.stream(cls.getMethods())
056                                .filter(m -> m.isAnnotationPresent(Import.Id.class)).findFirst()
057                                .orElse(null);
058        }
059
060        private static List<String> generateIfaceLines(
061                        Class<?> cls, Map<String, Class<?>> classByName
062        ) throws NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException {
063                List<String> lines = new ArrayList<>();
064                String simpleName = cls.getSimpleName();
065                String ifaceVarName = "i_" + simpleName.toLowerCase();
066
067                lines.add("# maps to Java interface " + cls.getName());
068                lines.add(
069                                simpleName.equals(
070                                                "Manifest"
071                                ) ? "# WARNING: Possible name conflict with java.util.jar.Manifest"
072                                                : ""
073                );
074                lines.add(
075                                simpleName.equals(
076                                                "Handler"
077                                ) ? "# WARNING: Possible name conflict with nonapi.io.github.classgraph.classloader.Handler"
078                                                : ""
079                );
080
081                lines.add(
082                                simpleName.equals("Manifest") || simpleName.equals("Handler")
083                                                ? "# " + ifaceVarName + "_iface <- interfacer::iface("
084                                                : ifaceVarName + " <- interfacer::iface("
085                );
086
087                Method idMethod = findIdMethod(cls);
088                Class<?> immClz = ReflectionUtils.immutable(cls);
089                Class<?> builderClz = immClz.getMethod("builder").getReturnType();
090
091                List<String> fieldLines = new ArrayList<>();
092
093                for (Method method : builderClz.getMethods()) {
094                        if (method.isAnnotationPresent(JsonProperty.class)) {
095
096                                String fieldName = method.getAnnotation(JsonProperty.class).value();
097                                Class<?> returnType = method.getParameterTypes()[0];
098
099                                String rType;
100                                String doc = "maps to java field " + simpleName + "."
101                                                + method.getName();
102
103                                // Foreign key: return type is another @Import-annotated interface
104                                if (returnType.isAnnotationPresent(Import.class)) {
105                                        rType = "integer"; // FK becomes integer ID
106                                } else {
107                                        rType = TYPE_MAPPING.getOrDefault(returnType, "character");
108                                }
109
110                                // Apply unique_id to ID field
111                                // Matching setXXX in builder with getXXX in interface
112                                if (method.getName()
113                                                .equals("s" + idMethod.getName().substring(1))) {
114                                        rType += " + unique_id";
115                                }
116
117                                rType += " + not_missing";
118
119                                fieldLines.add(
120                                                String.format("  %s = %s ~ \"%s\"", fieldName, rType, doc)
121                                );
122                        }
123                }
124
125                // Join fields with comma
126                if (!fieldLines.isEmpty()) { lines.add(String.join(",\n", fieldLines)); }
127
128                lines.add(")");
129
130                // Filter out empty warnings
131                return lines.stream()
132                                .filter(s -> !s.trim().isEmpty() || s.contains("WARNING"))
133                                .collect(Collectors.toList());
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Scans the given package for @Import-annotated interfaces and generates R
138         * iface() code.
139         *
140         * @throws SecurityException     if a security manager is present and denies
141         *                               access to class information
142         * @throws NoSuchMethodException if a required method (like builder()) is not
143         *                               found in the immutable class
144         * @param packageName the Java package to scan for @Import-annotated
145         *                    interfaces
146         * @param outputPath  the file path where the generated R code will be
147         *                    written
148         * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs writing to the output file
149         *
150         */
151        public static void generateSchemas(String packageName, Path outputPath)
152                        throws IOException, NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException {
153                List<Class<?>> importClasses = scanForImportAnnotatedClasses(packageName);
154
155                if (importClasses.isEmpty()) throw new IllegalArgumentException(
156                                "No @Import-annotated classes found in package: " + packageName
157                );
158
159                // Build lookup map by simple name
160                Map<String, Class<?>> classByName = importClasses.stream()
161                                .collect(Collectors.toMap(Class::getSimpleName, c -> c));
162
163                // Generate R code
164                List<String> rLines = new ArrayList<>();
165                rLines.add("# Generated by InterfacerSchemaGenerator");
166                rLines.add("# Do not edit manually\n");
167
168                for (Class<?> cls : importClasses) {
169                        rLines.addAll(generateIfaceLines(cls, classByName));
170                        rLines.add(""); // blank line between defs
171                }
172
173                // Write to file
174                Files.createDirectories(outputPath.getParent());
175                try (PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(
176                                Files.newBufferedWriter(outputPath)
177                )) {
178                        rLines.forEach(out::println);
179                }
180        }
181
182        /**
183         * Main method to execute the schema generation.
184         *
185         * @param args command line arguments: [0] package name to scan, [1] output R
186         *             file path
187         */
188        public static void main(String[] args) {
189                // === CONFIGURATION ===
190                String packageName = args[0]; // Change this to your package
191                String outputPath = args[1]; // Output R file
192                // =====================
193
194                try {
195                        generateSchemas(packageName, Paths.get(outputPath));
196                        System.out
197                                        .println("✅ Successfully generated R schemas at: " + outputPath);
198                } catch (Exception e) {
199                        System.err.println("❌ Failed to generate schemas: " + e.getMessage());
200                        e.printStackTrace();
201                }
202        }
203
204        private static List<Class<?>> scanForImportAnnotatedClasses(
205                        String packageName
206        ) {
207                try (ScanResult scanResult = new ClassGraph().enableAllInfo()
208                                .acceptPackages(packageName).scan()) {
209
210                        return scanResult.getClassesWithAnnotation(Import.class.getName())
211                                        .stream().filter(ClassInfo::isInterface)
212                                        .map(ClassInfo::loadClass)
213                                        .sorted(Comparator.comparing(Class::getSimpleName))
214                                        .collect(Collectors.toList());
215                }
216        }
217}
